comment.text:
Bones is famous in Atlanta and regarded as a top steakhouse. That said, they get by on name brand. 

The steak was cooked perfectly, but lacked seasoning or flavor

The truffle mashed potatoes lacked seasoning and had a odd consistency, they were not fluffy or soft.

The mushrooms were horrible and chewy 

Service was slow, for a meal of this caliber and compared to other steakhouses in the area it was disappointing. For the money, Little Alley is a better selection

I have been wanting to try this place for a while but it was very underwhelming. We had a reservation for five at 8:30pm on a Friday. The entire party arrived on-time, however, we weren't seated until 9pm which is the time that the restaurant closes. I was seated in the isle but was not a fan because people were bumping into me as they were walking past the entire night. We ordered our food and it didn't come for about 45minutes.  Which means we didnt eat until an hour after closing.

We ordered Two steaks, short ribs, fish, Foie Gras, Grit fritters, asparagus and mashed potatoes. Both of the steaks were undercooked and 4/5ths of the table agreed that the food was underwhelming. Once the steaks came back, they were tough and the potatoes were flavorless. The things we enjoyed were the Grit Fritters, I liked the Foie Gras and the person that ordered the fished enjoyed it. 

I also wasn't a fan of our primary server, Trevor. He mentioned that he had been drinking and was visibly annoyed whenever we requested something. He also ended up comping the two steaks because he admitted that they were undercooked since he put the order into the kitchen late and rushed the chef to get them out to the table. When orders go into the kitchen late, the entire table suffers because we all got our food late. He gave us free dessert but I personally don't eat sweets so it didn't really mean much to me.  Our server gave us our checks and left before we could even pay. We had to flag another server down to check us out.

The server John, that checked us out was far nicer and I have a feeling that we would've enjoyed our dinner more if he had've been our server the entire night. John is the only reason why I might try this place again. He was really great. I might come back but I would sit at the bar or anywhere else besides Trevor's section.

When you think Atlanta and, off-chain, authentic steakhouses, Bones has to be near the list.  All the dining etiquette classes taken in high school or college become readily useful as the servers and atmosphere leaves nothing to be desired.  My favorite restaurant in Atlanta and I wish I could visit more often.  When you get the check, don't have a cardiac event, lol! Just know that you have paid for a dining experience unlike many others.

A friend & I had a nice, expensive and intimate dinner here on Saturday evening.  Valet was tip based. Servers were friendly. Food was delicious.  We ordered Wagyu Carpaccio, 20 oz. Bone-In Ribeye & Onions Rings. We also had decent drinks. I didn't like having 5o sit downstairs because it was colder and seemed more dim. Overall, dinner with a friend was nice & worth it.

photos.caption: Dry Aged Bone - In Rib Eye

comment.text:
This is my second time coming to this place and it was as good the second time as the first time. The service is wonderful and the food is just great. Their steaks are the highest quality and most importantly for me, never overcooked. I came with a group of people and for appetizers we ordered the beef carpaccio, foie gras, the wedge salad and another salad with apples in it. I'm a huge fan of wedge salad in general so that was delicious! The beef carpaccio was amazing as well. I didn't care for the foie gras that much because it was too sweet for me, but that's just personal preference.
For the main dishes, we got two different kinds of steak, a T-bone and something else but they were so wonderful. I'm a huge carnivore and this really satisfied the carnivorous side of me haha. 
For dessert, we got the pecan pie and a chocolate mousse cake thing. Both were wonderful! The pecan pie was so warm and the pecans were still a little crunchy and not soggy. I loved the chocolate raspberry cake because it wasn't sweet at all! I didn't feel terrible after eating it. 
Overall, such a great experience and if I'm ever craving meat, I would definitely come here again!

Great Place, reminds me of the old school steak joints in Chicago. Amazing food, with a atmosphere.

The Lobster Bisque is really good, the Filet Mignon was cooked perfectly, and the sides (Asparagus and Truffle Mashed Potatoes) were all excellent.

The overall quality was great, now that does come with a price point to be expected of a high end steak place so make sure you're okay with that.
Perfect place to go for a special occasion! The service was amazing, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was lovely. Plan to spend a pretty penny, it's worth is though!

Let's start with that my husband and I are not super fancy or hoity toity (spelling? LOL) people, but we do LOVE really good food. If you're trying to save money this is not the restaurant for you, but it is great for a special occasion, but I did get a little wide-eyed when we got the bill. Ha! It did not help that my husband is a wine snob and ordered 2 glasses of $100/glass wine. It still tasted terrible to me, but I also don't care for wine so I'm definitely not the person to be giving accurate wine reviews. He ordered two of them so it could not have been terrible. :)


We went around the New Year and it did not disappoint. It's rated the #1 steakhouse in Atlanta for a reason. The "Bones" salad is outstanding - probably the best salad I've ever had. The husband isn't a salad person so he always makes fun of me when I order salads when we are out, but this salad really, really is worth the purchase. My husband ordered a steak (NY strip) I order dry aged, bone in ribeye. Both were cooked to perfection. We also ordered two sides  (shareable!) - corn pudding (another must have) and asparagus (nothing special about it, it was cooked well). 

Service was definitely on par with what you'd expect for this type restaurant. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. Reservations are a must!

Excellent place for a great steak, sides and wine! Excellent romantic ambiance, great service and a spot we'll revisit when we return to Atlanta! We took our friends there for their anniversary and it was amazing! We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: My Boy Marvis about to enjoy his Steak!

comment.text: I highly recommend Bones for the best steak in Atlanta The service was very good Will be back next week

What a wonderful atmosphere!   Lots of grown folk old school steakhouse vibes.

Appetizer 
- tuna- snack your momma hood!  Small portion but every bite delivers 
- octopus- ok

Entree
Filet mignon- yum!
Stuffed trout- tasty

Environment: The look of the restaurant is definitely along the lines of your classic American steakhouse. There are lots of wood and brass features and the décor is a bit dated. However, you still get the upscale ambience and I liked the location of the big bar as the main centerpiece.

Food/Drink: Ordered the Grilled Baby Octopus with Fennel Salad as an appetizer. The entrées were the Seared Scallops with Swiss Chard, Wild Mushrooms and Bones Bacon and the Red Snapper with Sea Beans in a Sun Dried Tomato Vinaigrette. And to round it out, ordered the Sautéed Green Beans, Truffle Butter Mashed Potatoes, Sautéed Mushrooms for accompanying sides. Had a couple glasses of red wine to drink.
All of the food was delicious! They definitely know what they're doing over here.

Service: Honestly, the service was nothing to write home about (at least IMO for this visit). It wasn't bad, but nothing about the server was memorable in terms of friendliness or going above and beyond to further my experience. I received everything I ordered so I guess that's what really matters right?

In summary, I had been wanting to check out Bones for years and am finally happy to say I can cross that off my list. The food was on point and lived up to the hype so, that alone is definitely worth a return trip.

photos.caption: Grilled Baby Octopus with Fennel Salad.
Grilled Baby Octopus with Fennel Salad.
French 75 and digital and printed menus.

comment.text: I went to Bones with my husband for celebratory dinner. It was a beautiful experience. The service was efficient, professional and top notch, the drinks were tasty and the food was phenomenal. We started with Smoked Salmon & Shrimp Cocktail appetizers - then moved to the Wagyu for our entree. The Wagyu was like butter! Our sides were the collard greens and baked potatoe. We ended the meal with Berry compote cheesecake and pecan pie. I would definitely recommend this establishment. I've had the pleasure of visiting 7 out of 10 Zagat Top Ten Fine Dining restaurants and they are deserving of their 4.8 rating for sure.

We decided to stop in Sat night after the chaos at the airport 11/20/21. They were full for the evening and weren't accepting anymore reservations so we sat at the stools facing the mirror for cocktails only until searing at the bar became available. They put our name on the waitlist as we ordered our drinks.

The service at the bar was good even on a busy Saturday evening.

Started w/ old fashioned, good but needed 1 cube 

The bisque was good but had a bite to it. You can see from the picture there are bits of lobster in there. There was even larger chunks in the soup itself.

Be careful not to get full on the warm bread & butter

I ordered the mixed grill and requested medium+ for the temperature. It came out more medium or even less warm that that. I will put it in the air fryer for a minute to bring it to the temperature I need it to be. All the meats aside from the pheasant sausage needed a dash of salt.

My husband ordered the loin lamb chops and was pleased with the order. They are huge and had a good grill flavor to them. They could used a dash of salt or not.

The truffle butter mashed potatoes were very good, though a little crumbly in texture.

I enjoyed the grilled asparagus, not pictured here. They are larger spears and still had a slight crunch to them. There was a perfect amount of char on them.

The pecan pie was nuked too long in the microwave. It tasted overcooked and the chocolate had that burnt taste to it. I had to cleanse my palette with one of the cheese wafers.

Bones is an Atlanta staple. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Mixed Grill (lamb chops, filet mignon, & pheasant sausage)

comment.text:
Exceptional service from the moment you get out your car at valet to the moment your car is returned.
Came here after all research saying this is the best steakhouse in Atlanta.
The lobster bisque was very nice and lots of lobster chunks. Snapper cooked perfectly. Sides we ordered were tasty. However, I'd like them to have been warmer.
We had such a nice experience...it was the first time in a long time we all are planning to return separately.

photos.caption: Chocolate torte with vanilla whipped cream and raspberry coulis

comment.text:
One of Atlanta's quintessential steakhouses, Bones has long been a go-to for high end steaks, wine, and believe it or not, the soups. Both their French Onion and the lobster bisque are unbelievable!

I really like that there are lots of little private nooks and crannies, so you never feel like you're in such a large restaurant. There's always enough privacy to have a personal or business conversation without having to raise your voice to be heard. 

It's not a "can't miss" for me, but it's a solid and reliable option in a city with an ever-changing food scene.

What can you say about this place? Beautiful, classic American steakhouse and what I consider to be one of the best in the city. Certainly expensive but you get what you pay for in my opinion and the value seems to meet the price tag for me.

A restaurant for a very special occasion, the staff at Bones treats every guest like royalty. They are focused on the details and want to ensure you have an exceptional experience here. I think it's a place every person living in the area or visiting needs to patronize at least once. 

Myself personally? I'll be making sure to visit at least every couple of years.

I love everything about this restaurant, the service was top notch ! 

The food was undeniably good, I was impressed by everything I had just because the restaurant had been super hyped up and it lived up to all the hype. 

Their specialty martini is literally the best one I've ever had... idk what they do that makes it so special but I still think about it to this day. 

The A5 Wagyu appetizer, I think it was a 6oz portion and I wanted another once it was gone. 

Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: A5 Wagyu appetizer  Must try, absolutely worth the price
Another steak and the best martini I've ever had
Oscar style steak  Multiple sides ( Hash Browns, Corn Pudding, Greens)  Sides were AMAZING

comment.text:
We were on vacation in Atlanta visiting family, it was my bf's bday week so I made a reservation with OpenTable with Bones. We had a reservation for 4 adults. I am not sure if they take walk-ins so I just recommend making a reservation. 

We were welcomed with a decorated table for bf's bday (I put a note for bday on reservation). A lot of reviews advised to get the Lobster Bisque... I was not impressed... I wish I would have got the French Onion (which bf did get) and it was SO good... 

They have a bone-in filet mignon (which I didn't know was a thing) because the filet doesn't have a lot of fat, the bone apparently adds TONS of flavor to the cut. I went with my go to Rib-eye, which was perfectly cooked.

The sides are big enough to share for four, I chose the truffle mashed potatoes (SO good), we also got Mac & Cheese, and bf got himself a classing baked potato. Everyone loved the mac & cheese but those truffle mashed potatoes were out of this world! 

They gave us a delicious layered ice cream cake dessert. It had rum raising, chocolate, vanilla, and it was SO yummy and it was so kind that it was complimentary! They have an extensive wine/spirits list if you're into that thing.

photos.caption: Dry Aged Bone - In Rib Eye

comment.text:
Enjoyed a lovely dinner at Bones. The restaurant is an Atlanta classic steak house. The menu doesn't change often and the decor is a bit dated but that's part of the charm I imagine. 

We had a large party and used a private room downstairs. Service was great, the team was very attentive and made great recommendations. We enjoyed martinis to start and then migrated to Pinot noir. The table enjoyed the filet, rib eye, crab stuffed trout, truffle mashed potatoes(delicious), mushrooms, wedge salad, avocado and crab salad(yum), and more!

Valet only, definitely make a reservation although eating at the bar looks like a good time as well.

The food was amazing. The service was excellent, our waiter was very polite and funny. The ambiance reminded me of an old country club: dim lighting, lots of wood panels and very cozy feeling. Also enjoyed all the dog photos-- yes, Bones is in reference to dog bones! 

I had the short rib with collards, mashed potatoes and macaroni. The short rib was delicious! I did not enjoy the macaroni but the collards and mashed potatoes were really good! A friend had the crab cake which was also really good!

I'm not in Atlanta very often, but every time I make the trip down here, Bones is on the list of must-visit places...  
It's the only place around to get an amazing Japanese Wagyu strip- always cooked perfectly. The sides are all southern comfort foods, prepared carefully and presented well. 
Staff is top notch every time, as would be expected. They never disappoint.

I had really high hopes for Bones. To be labeled as Atlanta's best steakhouse meant I expected to be WOWed. Some parts of our experience were great, and some were disappointing.

First, we arrived early for our reservation but they were happy to seat us early once a seat became available. We waited in the bar area and were immediately offered drinks while we waited. This server was wonderful. I wish he was our server the whole time. Once we arrived at our table, I saw that they had decorated our table with little confetti because we were celebrating our anniversary. That made me smile the whole dinner!

I ordered the French onion soup and filet, and my husband got the New York strip. We also got macaroni and cheese to share. The soup was good and macaroni and cheese was great. The steaks, unfortunately, just weren't. My filet seemed more like a sirloin in texture and was overcooked (almost medium well, yikes!). Admittedly, I was a little sad.

They were kind enough to give us a Mountain High Pie in celebration of our anniversary, which I thought was really nice. It was basically an ice cream cake. Tasty, but I don't think I would order it for myself in the future.

Overall, an enjoyable dinner but I don't think it was worth the price.

photos.caption: Mountain High Pie - A Bones Tradition

comment.text: Great ambiance and food, we enjoyed our anniversary dinner here very much. They even threw in some free dessert which was nice

First, I'd like to start by saying my friends and I have a steak club where we visit top rated steak houses around the world once a month. Bones is the best steakhouse that we have been to in Atlanta. The food, drinks and service are all top notch.

I came with my boyfriend to celebrate a new job on a Friday evening. It was our first time at Bones and we've heard so much about this place so we were definitely excited. We made a reservation two weeks in advance since their weekend availability seems to be booked out pretty early. While we arrived 10 minutes early, the host was able to seat us immediately.

We ordered onion rings as an appetizer. FYI, you are apparently able to order half portions of this. The server offered the half portion, but we decided to order the full portion anyway and were shocked at how large the onion rings were! We also ordered a bone-in rib eye and a dry aged bone-in rib eye, both medium rare, and a side of truffle mashed potatoes. The bone-in rib eye was fine but half of the dry aged one was basically raw. At that point, it's too late to tell them that it isn't cooked properly. It's disappointing that a steakhouse would improperly cook a steak like this when this is what they specialize in. It was extremely hard to finish. 

The service itself was impeccable and our waiter was courteous. I only wish that we were able to get our steak taken back sooner. We didn't tell them since half was eaten already. They clean your table and package leftovers in between courses. 

Parking is valet only and complimentary, but you should definitely tip!

I'd say this is probably the best quality steak in Atlanta. There many other high-end places, but this one has received the most praise from every person I've come with. 

The service is impeccable. Every waiter is incredibly knowledgeable about EVERY dish on the menu. I had questions about portion size, allergies, cooking oils, dietary restrictions. Our waiter throughly answered them all and went above and beyond to change certain dishes. I personally don't drink, but they had a very extensive wine list and the waiter even knew every wine! 

For dessert, I recommend their Mountain High Pie!!

photos.caption: Mountain High Pie - A Bones Tradition

comment.text: Cannot say enough wonderful things about our experience here.  We were celebrating my daughter's college graduation and everyone made her feel special.  When we arrived there was graduation confetti on the table which was very festive.  This to me is an "old school" steakhouse.  I loved that there was a dress code.  The service was phenomenal.  The food was outstanding.  We brought our own cake but they also served us their signature dessert as well.  This was a 10 out of 10 in my book.  Perfect for special occasion.  We will definitely return in the future.

I rated Bones okay because the service was stellar and the teamwork with them was great. The ambiance is great.  Elegant and visually pleasing to the eyes. However, the food, of which I had the NY Strip was far less than impressive.  The sweet potato casserole was half cooked and the mushrooms had no identity with respect to palatable flavor. Perhaps some of the other items are good but overall, I was nowhere near impressed by the food, but the ambiance and service were great. It was my birthday, and I was disappointed because I chose Bones and was not satisfied at the end of the meal.

Anyone who knows me knows I'm a fan of Bern's Steakhouse in Tampa. It's pretty much ruined me for ever enjoying any other steakhouse. No matter what steakhouse I go to, I'm always mentally comparing my experience to the high bar that Berns's has set.

After eating several steaks in Atlanta, I finally made my way to Bones, which was billed as a perfect Atlanta institution. I can see why. The steak was excellent. The French onion soup was excellent. The potato cake cooked in butter was amazing. The waiter was superb. Everything about the meal and service flowed smoothly.  If I had to rate this place from zero to 100, where zero is worst and 100 is Bern's, I'd give this place a 98. 
 
COVID stuff: Visited December 2020. Staff wore masks. We ate inside, and the tables were distanced.

One of our most favorite restaurants of all time. As soon as we knew we were going to be in the area we made our reservations (strongly suggested).  Our appetizers were amazing!  The grilled octopus was prepared perfect extremely tender (not rubbery). The crab and lobster napoleon was to quote our son "the best thing I have ever eaten!"  For entrees we had the dry aged ribeye (the best!!), the strip and the bone in ribeye for two.  Always go for the aged beef, may cost more but is so much better.  Shared sides hash browns (the best), spinach and mushrooms. Shared desserts mountain high pie, key lime, and pecan pie (the winner!).  Such a classy, enjoyable atmosphere and staff!! You will LOVE this place!

photos.caption: Dry Aged Bone - In Rib Eye
Crab and Lobster Napoleon (Best thing my son has ever put in his mouth!!)

comment.text: We had a great experience last night. Definitely different from Hal's the night before as in atmosphere. Bones was much more refined compared to Hal's but both offered a great experience. Bones staff members were on point and always around to to accommodate whatever we needed. "Mark" our head server has been there over 30 years and was a consummate professional. Steaks and appetizers were all very delicious. My only issue I had was that my stuffing in the trout dish I ordered was a tad fishy(we always order a steak and seafood dish to split if you're wondering why I order a fish dish at a steak house, ). They corrected that dish right away and everything thing else was phenomenal. Shout out to "Ubee" who took our reservation and got us in on a very busy Friday and put us a very nice room to ourselves. Bones is a go to if you're in Atlanta!

photos.caption: Bone - In Rib Eye with Fois Foie Gras
Nice secluded dining area for our group
Bone - In Rib Eye with Foie Gras

comment.text:
Service A+
There was a team of efficient staff attending to our needs. When I had to send my steak back, they brought out a small plate of pheasant sausage. 
Food B+
My bone-in filet was excellent, baked potato, bones salad all great. My wife's salmon was below average, cheesecake ok. 
Ambiance B+
Love the wood, ceiling, leather and bustling wait staff.  Just thought the caricature drawings all over the walls were a bit cheesy.

I really wanted to love this place. It's beautiful inside. Perfect for drinks with friends or a first date. The bar is gorgeous. The staff is amazing. Rodney was our waiter and 5 stars! He was fantastic. 

However the food was only okay. I really expected the food to be fantastic. For appetizers we got the onion rings they were yummy; it's hard to go wrong lol. We also got Crab and Lobster Napoleon with Chardonnay Cream it was good, very small portion and only good; Didn't blow my mind or taste buds. For my entree I got the lobster bisque and the crab and avocado salad. The lobster bisque went to waste, I couldn't eat it. I've had better soup out of a can it was salty , thick, strangely flavored , and no lobster; I would not recommend - so disappointed. My salad was good, would recommend. 

On the table my boyfriend got the 20oz bone in rib-eye and added the herb and the Truffle Butter Mashed Potatoes he liked his steak. We've had better unfortunately. The potatoes we also very average I hoped they'd taste a bit more like truffle butter. My friend had the strip and it was almost well done so poorly cooked. Her sister had the stuffed trout which was the most delicious plate on the table! Please get that!!

The drinks were fabulous we had gimlets all around. Very delicious. And the ice cream cake was phenomenal. 

I would recommend. Not the best food in the city but the experience was nice. Cute for pre drinks.

photos.caption: Crab and Avocado Salad - would recommend

comment.text:
A Dining Gem

Bones Restaurant was our choice to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. It is the perfect place to celebrate any special occasion or to make an ordinary occasion special. Superlative service, attentive, helpful, and friendly. Mark, the Server, and the team made the celebration and dining perfect. Food is perfectly prepared, flavorful, and delicious. Attractive decor. Recommend: Shrimp Cocktail, Bones Salad, Filet Mignon, Hash Browns, and Mountain High Pie - a Bone's tradition. Kudos to Bones, the Servers, and the Chef(s) for providing a perfect celebration.
Perfectly cooked, flavorful yummy steaks! Sides were also amazing. An Atlanta institution for a reason.

This place is rich in history.  A most stop if you like steak. Serve was really good most of the time. Enjoyed sitting at the bar for drinks then was then downstairs for our meal. Loved the atmosphere. Waiter was very helpful

Walking into the restaurant felt like a throwback to the decorum of 1960. We enter through a lounge with casual conversation where everyone is dressed very nicely. We are greeted by name by the Maitre'd and large service and wait staff. Absolutely feeling like royalty with this southern hospitality. (They even exchange your napkin from the table for a clean napkin if you get up to use the facilities.)
I haven't been treated this well in a restaurant in a long time (if ever!) 
Not to mention seeing everyone's smiling face and how much they seem to be enjoying their work! It is so encouraging. What a wonderful experience. I will never forget this marvelous dinner with my mom.

photos.caption: My mom and I talking about how soon we can fly across country to come back.

comment.text: Simply put Bones is the best steak house in Georgia. Not only amazing quality meat but amazing sides and drinks as well. Seafood and steak options were amazing and left us so excited to come back. The staff were so accommodating and put on an amazing service. The ambiance was very posh and high end I felt very comfortable spending my money and felt like it was worth every !
Be prepared for the prices but was a wonderful dining experience. If looking for an amazing old school steakhouse experience this is the place in Atlanta to go.

Overpriced, noisy. 
terrible mix-up with checks had the poor server scrambling while SEVERAL managers stood by apathetically!  Disappointed!
In Bones restaurant , only a food you want to eat is a Wagyu. There no more testing on others.

The food and service was spectacular. The only recommendation I have is that they update the interior. It's so dated, like back to the 80s.  I also have a pet peeve with restaurants that have carpeting because no matter how much you clean it .....it will never be clean!

Exceptional evening. Note: there is a dress code. Greeted for a group of 16 and seated in a side room. Drinks offered and served immediately. They have a back bar that serves seated guests so no waiting for a slot in the main bar.
the staff is very friendly and helpful. Explained all dinner options. The wine list is short but well chosen. We hang many bottles of a great cab and amazon. All the proteins were well prepared and at correct temps. The sides are shareable and delicious. It felt like a private event even though the restaurant had every seat filled.
Very highly recommended

Slainte!!

The service was top notch from beginning to end. Making reservations was simple and took a only a few minutes online.  When we arrived, a valet parked our vehicle.  We got there just as they were opening for dinner.  We checked in and waited less than five minutes for our table.  The waiting area is nice, with large chairs.  

We were seated at a table decorated with confetti for my girlfriends birthday.  Every person we came in contact with said happy birthday.  They quickly filled our water glasses and brought hot bread. The staff was very attentive and kept our glass filled.  

The steak was very palatable.  The sides are a la carte but the sides are shareable and will feed two to three.  The mashed potatoes were very savory.  The service was impeccable from the waiter to the man who filled the water glasses.  Everyone was friendly and professional.  We will go again.

This was our first time at Bones since we were visiting friends in Atlanta. 
From the outside it looks like a small restaurant, but when you go in it is pretty big! This restaurant has A LOT of history behind it which made the experience a lot of fun.
Before our reservation we ordered a cocktail. I got the Bones Martini which has stuffed blue cheese olives in it. WOW was it good!!! My husband got the old fashioned. I am not a bourbon person but it was so good.

When you sit down they provide you with a loaf of bread which is very fresh. You have to be careful because it's easy to eat the whole thing and not save room .

For appetizer I got the lobster bisque. Wow was it good. It reminded me of thanksgiving and was very hearty.

For dinner my husband got the bone in rib eye and I got the filet. If I could do it over again I would have done the bone in. It had a ton of flavor and was cooked perfectly. We also got a lobster tail to split. It was super juicy!!. 

The service is immaculate and the people are very kind. I know it's a fancy restaurant but we have always helped stack it clean. They made a joke that if we do it again he's gonna give us a 1099 when we leave . 

For dessert, we got the cheese cake and the pecan pie. For sure would get those again!

This place was awesome and we will be back.

Went here with three business associates and celebrated a birthday too. Bone in ribeye, truffle mashed potatoes and mushrooms for the steak.... Add in a beautiful wedge to start it all off. Amazing meal. Service was impeccable with a whole team of world class servers lead by Trevor. Thanks for a great night. Loved those onion rings too.

photos.caption: Dry Aged Bone - In Rib Eye to die for...

comment.text:
This is a great date place and the food is top notch.  They are doing a great job working through COVID restrictions and making everyone comfortable.  The steak was very palatable.  The sides are a la carte but the sides are shareable and will feed two to three.  The mashed potatoes were very savory. The meat is so superb, very tender and flavorful. The crab and avocado salad is to die for.

We went for the wife's birthday and they surely made it special. Decorations on the table, everyone was greeting her happy birthday, and the cake at the end was phenomenal. It's  no secret that this place is pricey but you get what you pay for. I would come here everyday if that was possible. My new go to place for special occasions!

photos.caption: Bone - In Rib Eye  or  for two

comment.text: My brother and I got dry aged ribeye and both got super sick next day, our other family members were fine tho...

My girlfriend gave me a choice between 3 great Atlanta-area steakhouses for my birthday dinner. I chose Bones. I've been to Bones once before and I was excited to revisit that experience. She made a reservation for the day before my birthday via OpenTable and was able to select that it was a special occasion on that platform.

Once at the restaurant, I utilized the complimentary valet service and we walked in. After a short wait, we were taken to our table which was downstairs. Since she booked on OpenTable, there was fun little confetti on the table. The party next to us had a birthday as well and they did not have confetti, so if you're planning a celebration, definitely check out OpenTable. 

I hadn't been downstairs before, but I really liked it. It felt more like a dining room than a restaurant. There were a couple of private dining areas for bigger groups down there that were fully utilized. It was a busy night at Bones!

We both started with a bourbon cocktail. She had the Kentucky Mule and I had the Bones Old Fashioned. Both were fantastic. 

If you're thirsty for water, you won't be thirsty for long. The service staff is top notch here. Your water glass will never get to the half-empty point. Everyone works together on that team which is so great to see.

We opted to start with onion rings and I decided to get the French onion soup. The onion rings could easily get their own paragraph here. She liked this so much and said a few times how they're the best onion rings she's ever had. They weren't greasy at all. They were delicious. My French onion soup was really great too. Hard to go wrong on a chilly October night. 

On to the meal. I wanted a glass of red with my filet and she opted for white wine with her vegetable plate. She had asparagus, broccoli, and hash browns. They were all delicious. I knew I wanted dessert so I didn't get a side. I was already feeling pretty full by now anyway. The steak I ordered was so great. It was cooked to perfection. 

Once they took our plates, they mentioned they had a surprise coming out for us. To our surprise, they brought out a complimentary [huge] piece of their "mountain high pie" - a massive chunk of ice cream cake with meringue and a variety of flavors.

After dinner they gave us one more little treat of shortbread cookies in a small to-go box that were shaped like bones. Very fitting. 

We were both so impressed and we still talk about it often.

photos.caption: Bones menu with fun birthday confetti
